metadata.title: CVE-2021-31229 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in libezxml.a in ezXML 0.8.6. The functionezxml_internal_dtd() performs incorrect memory handling while parsingcrafted XML files, which leads to an out-of-bounds write of a one byteconstant.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-31229` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

scilab - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-cli - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-data - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-full-bin - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-include - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-minimal-bin - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-test - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mapcache package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
scilab package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1').
netcdf package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
navit package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
